definition: to fall/to tumble/to trip/(of prices etc) to drop/Taiwan pr. [die2]

sentences.english: In the downdraft from a commodity sell-off, the dollar would be the perverse winner.
sentences.chinese: 隨着商品證券跌價，美元將會成爲勝之不武的贏家。

sentences.english: His house is falling in price.
We could reduce our price by 5% if you place a substantial order with us.
sentences.chinese: 要是你們定貨量大的話，我們可以跌價5%。

sentences.english: The risk, of course, is that the forint devalues or depreciates.
sentences.chinese: 風險當然是福林貶值或跌價。

sentences.english: The prices of BW TV sets have gone down.
